bibl.title: Letter from John P. Corrigan to Henry Hanson, August 23, 1921

div1.p: Corrigan relates the results of mosquito control inspections on farms.

div1.head: Letter from John P. Corrigan to Henry Hanson, August 23, 1921
div1.opener:
DIRECCION DE LA CAMPAÑA SANITARIA
CONTRA LA FIEBRE AMARILLA
EN LOS
DEPARTAMENTOS DEL NORTE
----
OFICINA CENTRAL
----
Copy:
Chiclayo, Peru, August 23rd, 1921-
Dr. Henry Hanson, M.D.
Director de la Campaña Sanitaria,
Chiclayo - Peru.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to inform you that I have inspected
“Hacienda San Jacinto”, and its annexes: “San José” and
“Huaco Tambo”. Both inspections were made during the week
ending August 13th. The breeding of stegomyia in containers
at “San Jacinto” was little over one per cent of the numbers
of containers examined. At both the latter places no breeding
was found. Considering the large percentage of breeding at
“Samanco” and “Nepeña” (mentioned in separate report) in com-
parision with the small percentage found at the three fore-
going places; I am sure that you will agree that the gentle-
man in charge, the “Administrador”, Mr. Gordon, has the in-
terest of the places under his charge - at heart.

Mr. Gordon has arranged to distribute fish in all the
water containers in houses at “Hacienda San Jacinto”, with
the object of eliminating the stegomyia entirely.

I would appreciate it very much if you would thank Mr.
Gordon for the facilities and aid given us by him during our
stay at the place.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, (Signed) John P. Corrigan.
Inspector Sanitario.
